about.name: Shanghai
about.info_text: Shanghai, often referred to as the 'Pearl of the Orient,' is a dynamic and cosmopolitan metropolis located in eastern China. It is the country's largest city and a global financial hub. Shanghai is known for its impressive skyline, rich history, and a unique blend of Eastern and Western cultures. With a vibrant arts scene, bustling shopping districts, and a wide range of culinary delights, Shanghai offers an exciting and diverse experience for residents and visitors alike.
about.facts_text:
Population: Approximately 26 million
Province: Shanghai
Time Zone: China Standard Time (UTC+08:00)
Language: Mandarin Chinese
Currency: Chinese Yuan (CNY)
about.climate_text: Shanghai experiences a humid subtropical climate with four distinct seasons. Summers are hot and humid, while winters are chilly. Spring and autumn are pleasant and popular times to visit the city.

attractions_card.title: The Bund
attractions_card.description: The Bund is a historic waterfront promenade along the Huangpu River, offering iconic views of Shanghai's skyline and a collection of 52 unique buildings representing various architectural styles.

attractions_card.title: Shanghai Tower
attractions_card.description: The Shanghai Tower is one of the world's tallest skyscrapers and offers an observatory with breathtaking views of the city. It's an architectural marvel.

attractions_card.title: Yu Garden
attractions_card.description: Yu Garden is a classical Chinese garden with beautiful pavilions, rockeries, and ponds. It's a peaceful escape from the bustling city.

attractions_card.title: Jing'an Temple
attractions_card.description: Jing'an Temple is a historic Buddhist temple in the heart of the city, known for its tranquil atmosphere and golden Buddha statue.

attractions_card.title: Shanghai Disneyland
attractions_card.description: Shanghai Disneyland is a magical theme park with a distinct Chinese flair, featuring classic Disney attractions and entertainment.

attractions_card.title: Oriental Pearl Tower
attractions_card.description: The Oriental Pearl Tower is an iconic TV tower with a distinctive design, housing an observation deck and a museum.

attractions_card.title: Tianzifang
attractions_card.description: Tianzifang is a labyrinth of narrow lanes filled with boutique shops, cafes, and art studios, making it a popular spot for shopping and exploration.

attractions_card.title: Shanghai World Financial Center
attractions_card.description: The Shanghai World Financial Center is a skyscraper with an observation deck known for its dramatic views and the world's highest observatory bridge.

food_card.title: Xiaolongbao
food_card.description: Xiaolongbao are delicate, steamed soup dumplings filled with flavorful pork or other ingredients, often served with vinegar and ginger.

food_card.title: Shengjianbao
food_card.description: Shengjianbao are pan-fried buns filled with savory pork and a juicy interior, making them a popular Shanghai street food.

food_card.title: Hairy Crab
food_card.description: Hairy crab is a seasonal delicacy in Shanghai, known for its unique taste and flavor. It's typically enjoyed during the autumn months.

food_card.title: Scallion Oil Noodles
food_card.description: Scallion oil noodles are a simple yet flavorful dish made with spring onion oil, soy sauce, and wheat noodles, creating a delightful combination.

food_card.title: Stir-Fried Mianbao Xia
food_card.description: Stir-fried mianbao xia is a popular Shanghai dish featuring stir-fried rice cakes with vegetables and a choice of protein.

hotels_card.title: The Ritz-Carlton Shanghai, Pudong
hotels_card.description: The Ritz-Carlton in Pudong offers luxurious accommodations with stunning views of the city and the Huangpu River.

hotels_card.title: W Shanghai - The Bund
hotels_card.description: W Shanghai is a trendy and modern hotel along the Bund, known for its chic design, rooftop bar, and scenic river views.

hotels_card.title: Fairmont Peace Hotel
hotels_card.description: The Fairmont Peace Hotel is a historic and elegant hotel on the Bund, offering a timeless atmosphere and excellent service.

hotels_card.alt: JW Marriott Hotel Shanghai at Tomorrow Square
hotels_card.title: JW Marriott Hotel Shanghai at Tomorrow Square
hotels_card.description: The JW Marriott at Tomorrow Square is a luxury hotel with spacious rooms and a central location in the city.

hotels_card.title: Hyatt Regency Shanghai, Global Harbor
hotels_card.description: Hyatt Regency in Global Harbor is a modern hotel offering comfortable accommodations and convenient access to shopping and dining.

transport_card.title: Shanghai Metro
transport_card.description: The Shanghai Metro is a comprehensive subway system that makes it easy to travel around the city and reach major attractions.

transport_card.title: Maglev Train
transport_card.description: The Shanghai Maglev Train is one of the world's fastest commercial trains, connecting Pudong Airport to the city center in just minutes.

transport_card.title: Taxis
transport_card.description: Taxis are readily available in Shanghai and are a convenient way to explore the city. They can be hailed on the street or booked through ride-sharing apps.

transport_card.title: Shanghai Pudong International Airport
transport_card.description: Pudong International Airport (PVG) is one of the main airports serving Shanghai, offering a wide range of domestic and international flights.
